text:
Running apxs -q with either CFLAGS or CFLAGS_SHLIB returns an empty string on my
setup. I am using linux 2.4.x with glibc 2.3.3 and gcc 3.3.3. The configuration
options for apache are simply the "most" shared modules option.
creator: patrick@spacesurfer.com
chip@force-elite.com
text:
Try using:
EXTRA_CPPFLAGS
EXTRA_CFLAGS
EXTRA_LIBS
EXTRA_INCLUDES

CFLAGS_SHLIB has never been used in APXS for Apache 2.0, and is only in APXS for
1.3 ( see Bug #28802 )

creator: patrick@spacesurfer.com
text:
On my setup:
EXTRA_CPPFLAGS appears to give the equivalent of the 1.3 apxs command
EXTRA_CFLAGS also gives some more less important stuff
EXTRA_LIBS is empty
EXTRA_INCLUDES gives a perl warning!
None of these are mentioned in the apxs man page which only mentions:
" CC,   CFLAGS,   CFLAGS_SHLIB,  INCLUDEDIR,  LD_SHLIB,
LDFLAGS_SHLIB, LIBEXECDIR, LIBS_SHLIB, SBINDIR, SYSCONFDIR, TARGET.  .PP"
Seems like this is just a lack of documentation on how APXS works for Apache 2.0?
creator: chip@force-elite.com
patrick@spacesurfer.com
text:
It would seem that documentation is the main problem, however it does seem a bit
weird that such a command should change in such a way as to break backward
compatability and for no obvious added gain.
Its just a perl script used by deleopers, why couldn't the original names have
been used!
It seems to me that because of these changes you would also need to add an extra
switch so that installtion scripts can tell whether they are using apache 1.3's
version of apxs or apache 2.0's!

creator: poirier@pobox.com
text: Closing for lack of activity.  Feel free to re-open if still an issue.
